  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was discovered leaking and QA was notified. Spill was clean and package was collect and placed in a plastic lined tote and placed in the QA damage area. Package was discovered to be regulated and there was no labels on the package declaring it so. The box was also inadequate for packing group III.

item.description:

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Upon inspection it was found that the package was wet from the top after being tipped over. It was discovered that the package contained 2 hazardous bottles (rapicidepa part a) and 2 nonhazardous bottles (rapicidepa part b). It was found that one of the part b bottles had a loose cap resulting in the leakage.

item.title: Report E-2024070640
item.description:
Report E-2024070640

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-29T09:15:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-28
  • City: SANTA FE SPRINGS
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that 2-gallons of UN2289 Baxxodur® EC 201 released from a 2000-pound plastic tote due to improper loading. Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 6ft-by-6ft area of the dock floor and estimated that two (2) gallons of material were released from one (1) 275-gallon tote. Clean Harbors personnel deployed absorbents and then swept up the released material. The damaged tote and recovered material were placed into four (4) 55-gallon poly drums and was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization.
